content: ++http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ltv1_Zx1uis ++http://en.rian.ru/world/20090430/121399710.html quote: Car rams crowd watching Dutch Queen's Day parade, 4 dead 21:17 | 30/ 04/ 2009 THE HAGUE, April 30 (RIA Novosti) - Four people were killed in the Dutch city of Apeldoorn on Thursday when a car careened through a crowd watching a royal parade for Queen's Day, national media reported. The incident occurred while an open-top bus carrying Queen Beatrix and other members of the royal family was passing the crowd in the city, some 90 km southeast of Amsterdam. The city mayor said four people were killed and 13 injured. It is not yet clear if the action, which is assumed to be deliberate, was an attack targeting the royal family. "The car appeared unexpectedly. It hit between 10 or 15 people. The scene is terrible, blood is everywhere. Some of the people have been taken to intensive care," a photographer who witnessed the incident told national radio. Video footage of the incident showed the damaged vehicle continuing to be driven at high speed after crashing through the crowd. A policeman on a bicycle narrowly escaped being hit by the car, which then slammed into a stone monument...

A policeman on a bicycle narrowly escaped being hit by the car, which then slammed into a stone monument...
title: Man in car rams parade with Dutch Royal Family

content: Just an update: a tragic end to an already sad story. ++http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/reuters/090501/world/international_us_dutch_royals quote: AMSTERDAM (Reuters) - A Dutchman who tried to attack Queen Beatrix and her family by driving his car at their bus during a parade on Thursday died of his injuries overnight, the public prosecutor said. Five people died and about a dozen were injured when the car plowed through a crowd of spectators, missing the bus by four or five meters, before slamming into a monument in the center of Apeldoorn, about 90 km (56 miles) east of Amsterdam. The prosecutor said the 38-year-old man died at about 0100 GMT on Friday. He had been charged with an attempted attack... (...)

Five people died and about a dozen were injured when the car plowed through a crowd of spectators, missing the bus by four or five meters, before slamming into a monument in the center of Apeldoorn, about 90 km (56 miles) east of Amsterdam. The prosecutor said the 38-year-old man died at about 0100 GMT on Friday. He had been charged with an attempted attack... (...)
